evidence.snippet: The EchoTip® AcuCore™ Ultrasound Biopsy Needle (ECHO-BX-3-22) is an endoscopic ultrasound needle
Trade/Device Name: EchoTip® AcuCore™ Ultrasound Biopsy Needle (ECHO-BX-3-22)
Also, please note the regulation entitled, "Misbranding by reference to premarket notification" (21 CFR Part 807.97).

intended_use.value: This device is used with an ultrasound endoscope for fine needle biopsy (FNB), of submucosal and extramural lesions, mediastinal masses, lymph nodes and intraperitoneal masses within or adjacent to the GI tract.

evidence.snippet:
This device is used with an ultrasound endoscope for fine needle biopsy (FNB), of submucosal and
 extramural lesions, mediastinal masses, lymph nodes and intraperitoneal masses within or adjacent
 to the GI tract.

indications_for_use.value: This device is used with an ultrasound endoscope for fine needle biopsy (FNB), of submucosal and extramural lesions, mediastinal masses, lymph nodes and intraperitoneal masses within or adjacent to the GI tract.

evidence.snippet:
Indications for Use (Describe)
 This device is used with an ultrasound endoscope for fine needle biopsy (FNB), of submucosal and
 extramural lesions, mediastinal masses, lymph nodes and intraperitoneal masses within or adjacent
 to the GI tract.

predicate_devices.value: EchoTip ProCore® HD Ultrasound Biopsy Needle

evidence.snippet: the predicate EchoTip ProCore® HD Ultrasound Biopsy Needle

testing_summary.value:
Non-Clinical and/or Clinical Tests Summary & Conclusions
The following non-clinical testing was performed on the subject device to support this
submission.
- Needle Crumpling Compression test intended to challenge the ability of the ECHO family of
Endoscopic Ultrasound needles to withstand handle angulation. All test articles met the
acceptance criteria.
- Suction Test intended to assess the ability of the performance of the device to meet the
requirement to perform suction at endoscopic ultrasound needle device based on the suction
pressure created by the syringe. All test articles met the acceptance criteria.

- Needle Puncture Test intended to evaluate the comparative performance and function of
Endoscopic ultrasound needles in terms of puncture force. All test articles met the acceptance
criteria.
